subject: Relationships
title: DARVO: The Abuser's Playbook
description: A short lesson to help you apply DARVO: The Abuser's Playbook.

hook.text: You confront them about lying. Somehow, ten minutes later, you're the one apologizing. How did that happen?

buildup.text: DARVO stands for Deny, Attack, Reverse Victim and Offender. It's a predictable manipulation pattern.

discovery.text: First they deny the behavior. Then they attack you for bringing it up. Then they claim they're the real victim.

twist.text: DARVO is so effective because each step exploits a natural human response: doubt, guilt, and empathy.

climax.text: Once you recognize the pattern, the spell breaks. DARVO only works on people who don't know the name for it.

punchline.text: DARVO: Deny, Attack, Reverse Victim. Naming it breaks the spell.

quiz.question: What does DARVO stand for?
options: Deny, Attack, Reverse Victim and Offender
